text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JERUSALEM POST
- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Egypt's President Hosni Mubarak to meet on Tuesday.
- Foreign ministry officials upset at U.S., U.N. postings.
- For sale in Scotland: Lord Balfour's residence.
- Hyundai, IEC in $87 million deal come Sunday.
GLOBES
- Delay in issuance of Bank Mizrahi shares following dispute on board in matter of investigation at Bank Tefahot.
- U.S. Transportation Department orders halt of El Al flights to three stops in U.S.
- Former Bank Leumi head Ernst Japhet dies in New York.
- Bank of Israel Governor Jacob Frenkel envisages shekel as currency on world exchanges.
HAARETZ
- Mubarak to ask prime minister for halt in settlements.
- Head of Atomic Energy Commission in Israel: Democracy in Arab states is a condition for Israeli nuclear concession.
MAARIV
- Egyptian initiative: Four-way summit joined by Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat and Jordan's King Hussein.
- Strauss to take control of Elite on June 5.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Mubarak to Netanyahu: Renewal of negotiations in return for freeze of settlements.
- Shin Bet chief Ami Ayalon: Shin Bet must turn over responsibility in the territories to military intelligence.
- Egypt's Foreign Minister Amr Moussa: "Relations between Israel and Egypt were never plagued by so many problems."
